grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 敷設【フセツ】laying (a railroad, pipes, naval mines, etc.), construction
敷衍【フエン】expatiation, enlargement (e.g. on a point), elaboration, amplification, clear explanation, paraphrasing
kun reading compounds: 敷く【しく】to spread out, to lay out, to take a position, to impose widely (e.g. over a city)
